Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition InPatientEncounter

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
InPatientEncounter 0..*BaseA.2.3 - Encounter (eHN)
type 1..1CodeableConceptA.2.3.1 - Encounter type
note 0..1stringA.2.3.2 - Encounter note
admission 1..1BackboneElementA.2.3.3 - Admission
urgency 0..1CodeableConceptA.2.3.3.1 - Admission urgency
date 1..1dateTimeA.2.3.3.2 - Admission date
admitter 0..1BackboneElementAdmitting professional
identifier 0..1IdentifierA.2.3.3.3 - Admitting professional ID
name 0..1HumanNameA.2.3.3.4 - Admitting professional name
organizationID 0..1IdentifierA.2.3.3.5 - Admitting organisation ID
organization 0..1BackboneElementA.2.3.3.6 - Admitting organisation
source 0..1CodeableConceptA.2.3.3.7 - Admit Source
referringHP 0..1BackboneElementReferring professional
identifier 0..1IdentifierA.2.3.3.8 - Referring professional ID
name 0..1HumanNameA.2.3.3.9 - Referring professional name
organizationID 0..1IdentifierA.2.3.3.10 - Referring organisation ID
organization 0..1BackboneElementA.2.3.3.11 - Referring organisation
admissionReason 1..1BackboneElementA.2.3.4 - Admission reason
code 0..*CodeableConceptA.2.3.4.1 - Admission reason
comment 0..1stringA.2.3.4.2 - Admission reason comment
legalStatus 0..1CodeableConceptA.2.3.4.3 - Admission legal status
discharge 1..1BackboneElementA.2.3.5 - Discharge
date 1..1dateTimeA.2.3.5.1 - Discharge date
destinationType 0..1CodeableConceptA.2.3.5.2 - Discharge destination type
destinationLocation 0..1CodeableConceptA.2.3.5.3 - Destination location
location 0..*BackboneElementA.2.3.6 - Location - All locations/departments where the patient stayed (was boarded) within the hospital.
period 1..1PeriodA.2.3.6.1 - Period
organization 1..1BackboneElementOrganization
identifier 0..1IdentifierA.2.3.6.2 - Organisation Part ID
name 1..1stringA.2.3.6.3 - Organisation Part Name
details 0..1BackboneElementA.2.3.6.4 - Organisation Part Details

name: EncounterEhn
title: A.2.3 - Encounter (eHN)
description: Hospital Discharge Report - Encounter - A.2.3 eHN

element.definition: Hospital Discharge Report - Encounter - A.2.3 eHN
The type of the encounter whether inpatient or short stay encounter.
A narrative description of the encounter course.
Admission

element.definition: The health professional identification number. Either an internal identifier assigned by a healthcare provider institution or (preferably) a national health professional ID such as the licence or registration number.
Person name [the structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname)].

The healthcare provider organisation information.
From where the patient was admitted (e.g. physician referral, transfer).

element.definition: Reason or reasons for admission, e.g. Problem, procedure or finding.
Explanation of the reason for the encounter.

Legal status/situation at admission. The legal status indicates the basis on which the patient is staying in a healthcare organisation. This can be either voluntary or involuntary, however the legal status is always determined by a court. A patient can also receive healthcare based on a forensic status. (voluntary, involuntary, admission by legal authority).
Discharge

element.definition: The organisation’s part identifier.
Full name of the organisation part, e.g. Name of the department
Address, contact names and contact details, specialty of the organisation part.
Hospital Discharge Report - Encounter - A.2.3 eHN
The type of the encounter whether inpatient or short stay encounter.
A narrative description of the encounter course.
Admission
Admission type, either emergency or planned
Admission date and time.
Admitting Healthcare Professional

The health professional identification number. Either an internal identifier assigned by a healthcare provider institution or (preferably) a national health professional ID such as the licence or registration number.
Person name [the structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname)].
The healthcare provider organisation identifier.
The healthcare provider organisation information.
From where the patient was admitted (e.g. physician referral, transfer).
Referring Healthcare Professional

The health professional identification number. Either an internal identifier assigned by a healthcare provider institution or (preferably) a national health professional ID such as the licence or registration number.
Person name [the structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname)].
The healthcare provider organisation identifier.
The healthcare provider organisation information.
Admission reason
Reason or reasons for admission, e.g. Problem, procedure or finding.
Explanation of the reason for the encounter.

Legal status/situation at admission. The legal status indicates the basis on which the patient is staying in a healthcare organisation. This can be either voluntary or involuntary, however the legal status is always determined by a court. A patient can also receive healthcare based on a forensic status. (voluntary, involuntary, admission by legal authority).
Discharge
Discharge date and time
Type of location to which the patient will go after the encounter. E.g. home, hospital, nursing home, left against medical advice etc.
The location/organisation to which the patient will go after the encounter. Name, address and telecommunication contact.

element.short: A.2.3.6 - Location - All locations/departments where the patient stayed (was boarded) within the hospital.

Address, contact names and contact details, specialty of the organisation part.
